 Release Name----- Smallville.S10E13.HDTV.XviD-2HD
 Release Date----- 02/12/2011
 Release Size----- 350Mb
 Source----------- HDTV
 Play Time-------- 00:41:43
 Resolution------- 624x352
 Frame Rate------- 23.98
 Video Bitrate---- 1032kbps
 Video Codec------ XVID
 Audio -----------       48000 Hz 2ch, 128kbps
 Audio Codec------ MP3

 LONG: ASAP aka the new incarnation of DOT is using many of the same tricks they did
 including junk headers in their AVIs to pad it to size. By including these junk
 headers they are making their releases unplayable in some standalone players without
 remuxing. Included in /PROOF are pictures of what happens when you try to play their
 releases in the Phillips DV642. The files are renamed due to the 8 character name restriction.

 If you simply remux the file in Vdub, the result will be 1mb smaller and play perfectly fine
 however there is no reason to be padding releases and causing incompatibilities with playback.
 
 We thought this practice was done away with. Guess we were too hopeful. Enjoy thisworking
 release. Oh and lastly, how about cutting the end a bit better, it looks like it's missing something
 but it's not.

 **Yes we know the pictures are sucky quality but they do the job and yes we expect to be nuked
 but ASAP already got nuked on this issue the other day and then unnuked but obviously the problem
 isn't fixed **

 SHORT: junk.header.data.causes.issues.with.standalone.playback
